sub_topic: Finding the maximum flow in a network.
message_1:
Consider the following network:

```
         +--------+
         |   A    |
    4/5 /|   /    |\ 1/2
     /   |  /3    | \
    +----+ /      +----+
   S  2/ |/+------+|\ | 3\
         |   B    | \|   |  
         |        | /+---+ T
         +--------+
```

Find the maximum flow from source vertex S to sink vertex T in the given network, using the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm.
message_2:
To find the maximum flow from source vertex S to sink vertex T using the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm, we will iteratively find augmenting paths in the residual graph and update the flow along these paths until no more augmenting paths can be found.

1. Initial flow is 0. The residual graph is the same as the original graph.

2. Find an augmenting path: S -> A -> T. The bottleneck capacity is 1/2. Update the flow and the residual graph:

```
         +--------+
         |   A    |
    4/5 /|   /    |\ 0/2
     /   |  /3    | \
    +----+ /      +----+
   S  2/ |/+------+|\ | 2\
         |   B    | \|   |  
         |        | /+---+ T
         +--------+
```

3. Find an augmenting path: S -> B -> T. The bottleneck capacity is 2/3. Update the flow and the residual graph:

```
         +--------+
         |   A    |
    4/5 /|   /    |\ 0/2
     /   |  /3    | \
    +----+ /      +----+
   S  0/ |/+------+|\ | 1\
         |   B    | \|   |  
         |        | /+---+ T
         +--------+
```

4. Find an augmenting path: S -> A -> B -> T. The bottleneck capacity is 4/5. Update the flow and the residual graph:

```
         +--------+
         |   A    |
    0/5 /|   /    |\ 0/2
     /   |  /1    | \
    +----+ /      +----+
   S  0/ |/+------+|\ | 1\
         |   B    | \|   |  
         |        | /+---+ T
         +--------+
```

5. No more augmenting paths can be found in the residual graph.

The maximum flow from source vertex S to sink vertex T is the sum of the flows into T: 1/2 + 2/3 = 7/6.
